name: El Pardo DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could not have been more pleased. Room was large, and beds comfortable. No street noise, and very quiet. Used the Executive lounge on the 12th floor for breakfast, and had fruits, cereals, breads, etc. and they cooked us eggs to order. Concierge very helpful recommending tours, places to walk to nearby, restaurants, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent, comfortable, great location

reviews.text: We stayed here a few times during our stay in Peru. The first room we were given was a smoking room, not very nice as we are non smokers. However, the other two occasions we were given non smoking rooms. The rooms were a good size, clean and comfortable. There was a good of food at breakfast ... cooked or cereals, pancakes, yoghurts, fruits, breads and pastries. The staff were friendly and helpful. would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: I wasn´t expecting a huge amount as reviews on tripadvisor had been fair. However expectations way exceeded. Good room sizes, very clean (although one of our 3 rooms had an odd musty smell). Very helpful staff, and very good breakfast. After 2 weeks travelling in Peru which included some top range properties this wasdefinitely one of the favourites.
reviews.title: Oasis in the City

reviews.text: Recommended.
reviews.title: Great Price - Great Service - walk to everything

reviews.text: I stayed at the Doubletree Lima on three different occasions in the month of July. I was very very pleased with this Miraflores hotel. The price was really good, much much lower than what I found right near the water. The service here is some of the best that I have ever come across at a Doubletree property and I use Hilton properties often, as I am a Diamond Member. The rooms were huge, the beds comfortable bathrooms very clean and modern (i even had a bidet twice) and the staff helpful and efficient. It is about a 15- 20 minute walk to the beaches, but a quick cab ride. It cost me $20 usd to take a prearranged cab from the airport - about a 30 min drive. Great restaurants and stores within blocks. Take some time, just wander around and watch what the locals are doing...Kennedy park, 3 blocks away, has "events" on the weekends. I would stay here again. The only negative that I came across was the windows in one of my rooms were not insulated well and it was a bit noisy ( I was on a busy street) - I never mentioned it to the staff - i am sure if I would have they would have moved me.
reviews.title: Service with a smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the first two nights of our honeymoon. We paid for this on Hilton points so can't compare prices, and were upgraded due to being a Gold Member.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a nice large bedroom, with a huge bathroom, which included a jacuzzi bath and a sauna. Whilst the decor of the room wasn't top top quality (Beau Rivage Lausanne etc...), it was a perfectly acceptable, very comfortable hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Safe, Quiet, Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service of the staff was top quality, very helpful. We had breakfast in the hotel which was varied and the staff were attentive and when we wanted to leave, helped us pack breakfast in takeaway containers.
reviews.title: Excellent for a short stay in Lima
Briefly Put
reviews.text: This is definitely recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I checked into the Doubletree at 8AM since we arrived on an overnight flight from Miami. We were immediately recognized as Hilton members and our room was already prepared for us. We were even treated to breakfast and a large bowl of fruit was in our room. We were very tired since neither of us are able to sleep on airplanes. So, after a nice hot shower, in a wonderfully equipped bathroom, we went to bed for several hours. The beds are worth the extra money - they are Hilton's signature Sweet Dreams beds. We were lucky enough to catch Mr. Vilco (phone--[--]), the Doubletree concierge, before he left for the day around 6PM. This man is priceless. He arranged all our day trips for the eight days we vacationed in and around Lima. My wife did most of the planning for every day of our trip. Most of the trips Vilko arranged for us were not very expensive and he ensured we always had the best English speaking guides.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel with Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after our trip throughout Peru and just really enjoyed everything about the hotel. The hotel is conveniently located in the Miraflores neighborhood, we felt very safe walking around during the day and night. The staff was very warm, they are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are very pretty. I read some mixed reviews prior to going there, but the rooms were very nice in my opinion. Modern, clean and just feels like you are in a top notch hotel. If I ever go back, I would definitely come back to this hotel, good location, great rooms and convenience!
reviews.title: Love the hotel, staff and the location

reviews.text: Doubletree El Prado is a very business like hotel. It doesnt have a great campus, the rooms afford a bland view, and the service is stricly okay for the amount of money they charge.
reviews.title: Okay but overpriced

reviews.text: The staff at the reception alternates from good to mediocre, depending on their English speaking skills and your Spanish speaking skills
reviews.title: good location, nice staff & amenities, older rooms, for the monied

reviews.text: I cant comment on the convenience for business guests as I mainly stayed indoors for the conference and do not know how far I was from the actual Business center.Though, it was close to a busy street lined with all your daily needs like mobiles, supermarket and restaurants.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, what you would expect from DoubleTree

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What you do get free here, is wi-fi. that is a plus point. Also the concierge was a pleasure to talk to, and he did recommend and arrange local sight seeing well. I would recommned him as the only other plus point. The breakfast buffet was also nice.
reviews.title: Good location, Friendly Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started our 2 week trip in Peru in this hotel, and did find back a place with excellent and helpfull staff (we got our room when arriving early in the morning, no problem), it's a bit far located from Lima centre, but has a good location in Miraflores, walking distance to some good restaurants and larcomar, the rooms are up to level, clean and have all
reviews.title: excellent staff, good location in Miraflores

reviews.text: what you expect of a Hilton/doubletree hotel.
reviews.title: Stuck with noisy room

reviews.text: The hotel is a standard Doubletree. We got stuck in a room overlooking the busy boulevard, and the street noise was terrible. Avoid rooms whose numbers end in 02 (we got room 502 on the fifth floor). They face the busy street and the casino below, plus they have a sun window sticking out of the building and the noise just flows right through them. Aim for rooms with much higher numbers, such as 522 and you will have a much quieter room.
reviews.title: Needs Spiffing Up
Adequate
reviews.text: As a plus, the hotel is located near many restaurants in the Miraflores district.

While I only stayed one night at this hotel, after an early arrival into Lima, I expected more comfort than I got at the Doubletree. The rooms are small, the bathroom and towels dingy and if you're not up at a certain hour in the morning, you'll be awaken by the construction noise. The staff was cordial. The best thing the hotel has going for it is the concierge, Vilko Dorsner--Vilko is "dah man'! He'll get you into your restaurant of choice even at the last minute as he did in our case when we added two more to our reservation. He is very knowledgeable and indeed very helpful all the time displaying the most professional demeanor. I can't help but think he should be at a 5 star establishment--but then what else would the Doubletree have?
reviews.title: Nice Place

description: Enjoy the comforts of home at our Lima hotel in Miraflores, just 30 minutes from LIM airport. Offers fitness center, fine dining and Peruvian folklore shows.
